intro: Dombeya huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Dombeya huillensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
